listing.overview: Automate your Trello boards with rules, scheduled commands and custom buttons.
listing.description:
Automate your Trello boards with rules, scheduled commands and custom buttons.

With Butler you can:

- Create rules that trigger automatically when you perform actions on the board.

- Scheduled periodic commands.

- Customize Trello with buttons that perform your favorite actions on a card or on the board.

- The Butler automatically analyzes your recent usage and recommends buttons to save you clicks and time.

- Sort lists by due date, title, time in list, votes, labels or the value of a custom field.

- Create/copy/move/archive cards, add labels/checklists/due dates, assign to a member, and much more.

##Video##

[![Video](https://img.youtube.com/vi/Fj1xYSazQyg/0.jpg)](https://www.youtube.com/embed/Fj1xYSazQyg)

Note: video opens in a new tab.

listing.overview: For agile teams using Trello, Corrello gives you burndowns, burnups, CFDS, cycle time and more
listing.description:
The [Corrello](https://getcorrello.com?utm_source=trello&utm_medium=directory&utm_campaign=plugin) Power-Up for Trello instantly and seamlessly integrates with Trello giving you the charts you need in seconds. So while your team can continue using the tool they love, you can get the charts and reports you need to properly manage an agile project. With Corrello’s **burndown**, **burnup**, **CFD** and **Cycle Time** charts you have the everything you need to show your team how they are working and help them identify the bottlenecks where they can improve. Corrello also helps with reporting outside the team, adding some data and rigour when explaining estimates to stakeholders outside the team.

* **Identify and communicate bottlenecks** to your team with the Cumulative flow diagram and Cycle time stats.
* **Manage Sprint progress** and stay on schedule with the Sprint Burndown chart.
* **Keep your whole project on schedule** and communicate progress with the Release burnup.
* Keep on top of what’s happening over time with historical **counts of bugs**, **velocity** and work in progress, etc.
* Add a new level of data and rigour to reporting estimates and team progress in your projects.

Access your charts and Corrello dashboards from the link in the top right of your board after installing this Power-Up.


Some of our happy customers
-----*"**Corrello has transformed Trello from a delightful way to organize work into a powerful agile project management tool.** With Corrello's seamlessly integrated charts and analysis we can easily track the progress of all of our teams and projects. If you are using Trello to manage any Scrum, Kanban or other agile process, **get Corrello now. You are flying blind without it**."*
- Chris Brookins (CPO **HelpScout**)


*"The best agile tool for Trello"*
- Anita Taylor (PM **Stack Overflow**) ![Burndown](https://getcorrello.com/public/images/powerup/burndown.png)![Burndown in Trello](https://getcorrello.com/public/images/powerup/burndown_in_trello.png)![CFD](https://getcorrello.com/public/images/powerup/cfd.png)![CFD in Trello](https://getcorrello.com/public/images/powerup/cfd_in_trello.png)![CFD in Trello showing hover](https://getcorrello.com/public/images/powerup/cfd_in_trello_hover.png)![Cycletime chart](https://getcorrello.com/public/images/powerup/cycle_time.png)![Custom stats](https://getcorrello.com/public/images/powerup/stats.png)![tag](https://pixel-geo.prfct.co/sseg?add=10374746&source=js_tag&a_id=52651)![tag2](https://www.facebook.com/tr?id=1829177177394829&ev=PageView&noscript=1)

listing.overview: Agile Tools by Corrello allows you to add story points, WIP Limits and track card time in list.
listing.description:
Agile Tools by Corrello allows you to add story points, WIP Limits and track card time in list. It is fully integrated with [Corrello](https://getcorrello.com?utm_source=trello&utm_medium=directory&utm_campaign=agile_tools_powerup) **[burndowns](https://getcorrello.com/Burndown?utm_source=trello&utm_medium=directory&utm_campaign=agile_tools_powerup_burndown)**, **[CFDs](https://getcorrello.com/cumulative-flow-diagram?utm_source=trello&utm_medium=directory&utm_campaign=agile_tools_powerup_cfd)**, **burnups**, and **[cycle time](https://getcorrello.com/cycle-time?utm_source=trello&utm_medium=directory&utm_campaign=agile_tools_powerup_cycletime)** charts.

**Features:**

 - Story points on Cards
 - One click migration of points from Scrum for Trello
 - WIP limits
-  Count of Cards (or points) in each List
 - Card time in list
 - Slow card highlighting

Check out [Corrello](https://getcorrello.com?utm_source=trello&utm_medium=directory&utm_campaign=plugin) - Dashboards for Agile teams using Trello.

What are people saying about Agile Tools?
-----

*Software development is a messy process, planning is continuous and new Trello cards get added by the team on a daily basis. It is great to be able to **spot all unestimated cards with one click** and keep the scrum board estimated at all times. It is also extremely useful to get an **overview of the amount of points currently allocated in each Trello column**. This feature comes very handy when trying to understand whether we're putting too much work on our shoulders for our next sprint or whether it's possible to increase our scope.*
- Valentino Giudice (PM **Natural Cycles**)

Screenshots
-----

 ![Points picker](https://getcorrello.com/manifests/agiletools/images/set_points.png)

![Points on cards and lists](https://getcorrello.com/manifests/agiletools/images/list_points.png)

![Migrate points](https://getcorrello.com/manifests/agiletools/images/migrate_points.png)


![Set WIP limits](https://getcorrello.com/manifests/agiletools/images/wiplimits.png)


![Features GIF](https://getcorrello.com/manifests/agiletools/images/agiletools.gif)


![tag](https://pixel-geo.prfct.co/sseg?add=10374642&source=js_tag&a_id=52651)![tag2](https://www.facebook.com/tr?id=1829177177394829&ev=PageView&noscript=1)

card.name: Column Sprint (INT): Tasks that are being done in a previous sprint
Column DONE: tasks that pass QA can be archived here
Column QA: tasks ready to be tested for quality assurance
Column IN PROGRESS: tasks are currently being done
Column BLOCKED: An external impediment is where a dependency exists outside of the team, and the team are unable to progress an item until work outside of their control is done
Column TODO: list of tasks that must be completed during the sprint
Column BACKLOG: list of tasks that must be completed

old.name: BACKLOG:  list of tasks that must be completed

card.name: Column BUG REPORT: track down all the problems

old.name: BUG REPORT: track down all the problems

card.name: BUG REPORT: track down all the problems
BUG REPORT:
BACKLOG:  list of tasks that must be completed

NDVI and BAI don't show information about the time or time range that measure is referring to, so from the user perspective they don't have any utility. The scale should be in the range -1; 1.
NDVI and BAI don't show information about the time or time range that measure is referring to, so from the user perspective they don't have any utility. The scale should be in the range -1; 1.
change email address in the sentence on this card in the demo app
The time slider of the map shows (even if not working) dates until 5 days ahead, the plots show data only for the next two days
Display the year in the date of the map
Add time zone close to time references (Now the time is always in UTC, but the user is not aware of it)
The weather forecast data displayed now (coming from EAM) should be valid only for the 3 days forecast then MOGREPS data should be used for 3 to 7 days forecasts.

Convert unit of measure in more user friendly ones and in the ones used for Uganda. (e.g. convert from Kelvin to degree Celsius). This should be only on the display side, but the original data should be left untouched.

Because of the design and performances of the bash code that splits the weather forecast file in layers and of the general dataflow, the values displayed on map are completely wrong or referred to previous images systematically for enough well definable time windows that extend as much as the number of layers increase following a non-linear law
Time slider doesn't show how a certain phenomenon evolves in time.
Close to the scale should be written the unit of measure

In the maps, the transparency confuses the user that see color gradients that instead are not linked at all with the variation of the displayed variable. Moreover, the color in the map doesn't reflect the value on the legend so that it is impossible to know the absolute value.
In the attached image is seen a very abrupt change in temperature between the superior and inferior part and instead inside each pixel (that are not linked to resolution) the variation is smooth.
Display the year in the date of the map
The weather forecast data displayed now (coming from EAM) should be valid only for the 3 days forecast then MOGREPS data should be used for 3 to 7 days forecasts.

card.name: The priority must be define with the MoSCoW method
At the end of every sprint, all DONE tasks must be moved in a new sprint column
A link must be created for each task between Open Project and Trello & between GitLab and Trello
Every user stories must respect the format : As a [ROLE] I would I like to [REQUIREMENT] in order to [INTENT]
All the tasks must be understandable and prioritized before to be included in the current TODO list
MoSCoW method
card.desc:
The labels must be used to prioritize the tasks as described in the MoSCow method:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MoSCoW_method

data.text: Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1) stop Nifi 2) Add a new weather forecast nc file to the right S3 bucket 3) start nifi 4) go to demo.dfms.co.uk 5) select different layers and you will note that the layers are relative to different dates or show wrong values

cardSource.name: Because of the design and performances of the bash code that splits the weather forecast file in layers and of the general dataflow, the values displayed on map are completely wrong or referred to previous images systematically for enough well definable time windows that extend as much as the number of layers increase following a non-linear law

card.name: Because of the design and performances of the bash code that splits the weather forecast file in layers and of the general dataflow, the values displayed on map are completely wrong or referred to previous images systematically for enough well definable time windows that extend as much as the number of layers increase following a non-linear law

data.text: @rhea_callumdempseyleach Sure, I guess that here we just have to write the observed behaviour and the suggested solution without making also the Trello card very confusing and without mixing not related problems. This card is related to the async problem observed when a netcdf file is splitted into many to provide different raster data.  Ww won't talk about shapefiles and other things here but only about the specific problem raised :)

cardSource.name: Because of the design and performances of the bash code that splits the weather forecast file in layers and of the general dataflow, the values displayed on map are completely wrong or referred to previous images systematically for enough well definable time windows that extend as much as the number of layers increase following a non-linear law

card.name: Because of the design and performances of the bash code that splits the weather forecast file in layers and of the general dataflow, the values displayed on map are completely wrong or referred to previous images systematically for enough well definable time windows that extend as much as the number of layers increase following a non-linear law

data.text: @davidedelerma I have spoken with Corina who shares this position and I believe the best approach would be to concatenate a list of current problems that can be solved by not splitting the layers highlighting reasons for and against the proposed approach. Moving forward we can then give that to Arnaud for review.

cardSource.name: Because of the design and performances of the bash code that splits the weather forecast file in layers and of the general dataflow, the values displayed on map are completely wrong or referred to previous images systematically for enough well definable time windows that extend as much as the number of layers increase following a non-linear law

card.name: Because of the design and performances of the bash code that splits the weather forecast file in layers and of the general dataflow, the values displayed on map are completely wrong or referred to previous images systematically for enough well definable time windows that extend as much as the number of layers increase following a non-linear law

data.text: @rhea_callumdempseyleach Sure, this is what I proposed since the beginning :)

cardSource.name: Because of the design and performances of the bash code that splits the weather forecast file in layers and of the general dataflow, the values displayed on map are completely wrong or referred to previous images systematically for enough well definable time windows that extend as much as the number of layers increase following a non-linear law

card.name: Because of the design and performances of the bash code that splits the weather forecast file in layers and of the general dataflow, the values displayed on map are completely wrong or referred to previous images systematically for enough well definable time windows that extend as much as the number of layers increase following a non-linear law

data.text: @davidedelerma Can this be resolved by simply not splitting the files into multiple layers and pursuing the best/common practice of Geoserver layering - that is taking advantage of map attributes and distributing one file? The process of splitting into multiple layers seems superfluous when best practice and popular opinion seems to point out that we should split into one layer and manage from there (just because we can split it into multiple files doesn't mean we should).

cardSource.name: Because of the design and performances of the bash code that splits the weather forecast file in layers and of the general dataflow, the values displayed on map are completely wrong or referred to previous images systematically for enough well definable time windows that extend as much as the number of layers increase following a non-linear law

card.name: Because of the design and performances of the bash code that splits the weather forecast file in layers and of the general dataflow, the values displayed on map are completely wrong or referred to previous images systematically for enough well definable time windows that extend as much as the number of layers increase following a non-linear law

data.text: We can also have another possibility: let the user choose which forecast model they want to see. Therefore, if EAM is selected, display only the 3 day forecast, and if MOGREPS is selected, display the forecast for the next 7 days (actually I think it's 10 days, but anyway) using only MOGREPS data

cardSource.name: The weather forecast data displayed now (coming from EAM) should be valid only for the 3 days forecast then MOGREPS data should be used for 3 to 7 days forecasts.

card.name: The weather forecast data displayed now (coming from EAM) should be valid only for the 3 days forecast then MOGREPS data should be used for 3 to 7 days forecasts.

data.text:
The code that splits the weather forecast files in layers and serve it to Geoserver is very slow (it is much less performant than the one for plot which is O(n)). For this reason, as each new file only substitute the old one we have long periods of time for which the maps are out of sync. The situation will get worse adding more layers if no action will be taken.
The new files should be uploaded all at the same time on the machine if you really want to pursuit the way of splitting the file in layers and zip them.

cardSource.name: Because of the design and performances of the bash code that splits the weather forecast file in layers and of the general dataflow, the values displayed on map are completely wrong or referred to previous images systematically for enough well definable time windows that extend as much as the number of layers increase following a non-linear law

card.name: Because of the design and performances of the bash code that splits the weather forecast file in layers and of the general dataflow, the values displayed on map are completely wrong or referred to previous images systematically for enough well definable time windows that extend as much as the number of layers increase following a non-linear law

data.text:
```
ndvi = floor((ndvi/128) - 1); % [0 256] -> [-1 1]
ndvi = floor((ndvi + 1) * 128); % [-1 1] -> [0 256]
ndvi(ndvi < 0) = 0;             % not really necessary, just in case & for symmetry
ndvi(ndvi > 255) = 255;         % in case the original value was exactly 1
ndvi = uint8(ndvi);             % change data type from double to uint8
```

cardSource.name: NDVI and BAI don't show information about the time or time range that measure is referring to, so from the user perspective they don't have any utility. The scale should be in the range -1; 1.

card.name: NDVI and BAI don't show information about the time or time range that measure is referring to, so from the user perspective they don't have any utility. The scale should be in the range -1; 1.

data.text: Regarding the scale, values 0-255 represent RGB values and sometimes NDVI and other parameters/indexes are stored in this way in order to store data in unsigned 8-bit integer format (which is more efficient and not prone to round-off errors) rather than float, but if needed then they should be re-scaled on the fly to be displayed to the users in their original format (-1; 1).

cards.desc:
The labels must be used to prioritize the tasks as described in the MoSCow method:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MoSCoW_method
cards.name: The priority must be defined with the MoSCoW method
All the tasks must be understandable and prioritized before to be included in the current TODO list
Every user stories must respect the format : As a [ROLE] I would I like to [REQUIREMENT] in order to [INTENT]
A link must be created for each task between Open Project and Trello & between GitLab and Trello
At the end of every sprint, all DONE tasks must be moved in a new sprint column
Column BACKLOG: list of tasks that must be completed
Column BUG REPORT: track down all the problems
Column TODO: list of tasks that must be completed during the sprint
Column BLOCKED: An external impediment is where a dependency exists outside of the team, and the team are unable to progress an item until work outside of their control is done
Column IN PROGRESS: tasks are currently being done
Column QA: tasks ready to be tested for quality assurance
Column DONE: tasks that pass QA can be archived here
Column Sprint (INT): Tasks that are being done in a previous sprint
As user I would like to select a specific location in order to have detailed information on this area

cards.desc: This happens for all the variables
cards.name: In the attached image is seen a very abrupt change in temperature between the superior and inferior part and instead inside each pixel (that are not linked to resolution) the variation is smooth.

In the maps, the transparency confuses the user that see color gradients that instead are not linked at all with the variation of the displayed variable. Moreover, the color in the map doesn't reflect the value on the legend so that it is impossible to know the absolute value.
Close to the scale should be written the unit of measure
Time slider doesn't show how a certain phenomenon evolves in time.

cards.desc:
The code that splits the weather forecast files in layers and serve it to Geoserver is very slow (it is much less performant than the one for plot which is O(n)). For this reason, as each new file only substitute the old one we have long periods of time for which the maps are out of sync. The situation will get worse adding more layers if no action will be taken.
The new files should be uploaded all at the same time on the machine if you really want to pursuit the way of splitting the file in layers and zip them.
cards.name: Because of the design and performances of the bash code that splits the weather forecast file in layers and of the general dataflow, the values displayed on map are completely wrong or referred to previous images systematically for enough well definable time windows that extend as much as the number of layers increase following a non-linear law

Convert unit of measure in more user friendly ones and in the ones used for Uganda. (e.g. convert from Kelvin to degree Celsius). This should be only on the display side, but the original data should be left untouched.
The weather forecast data displayed now (coming from EAM) should be valid only for the 3 days forecast then MOGREPS data should be used for 3 to 7 days forecasts.
Add time zone close to time references (Now the time is always in UTC, but the user is not aware of it)
Display the year in the date of the map
The time slider of the map shows (even if not working) dates until 5 days ahead, the plots show data only for the next two days
